intro: Chamaeraphis, commonly known as sea rocket, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, erect growth habit and its ability to thrive in coastal and saline environments. The plants typically have basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. They produce small, white or yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes. Chamaeraphis species are often found in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines.
